body.p:
I have received your worthy letter with a willing soul. Why
and wherefore have you turned down my important articles without telling
me a word ? “Is this the Torah and this its reward?” If I could have
suspected this, I would have offered them to a different publication.
How can your newspaper prosper ? In your time it has had a good develop-
ment. You will never be finished with this stuff of de Sala
when only the very few learned people in the world are interested in it. “The dwel-
ler in heaven laughs”, for God hears my laughter?. “God mocks them”.
Whom, then, Who is interested in Ellis Joseph's present gift, who leaves
his congregation like sheep without a shepherd? That's fodder for the
“Messenger”. I regret this matter very much. This affair will be old
news next week. I have some more material, especially Krones, of Bres-
lau, sent me his excellent program for the Frankel seminary of January
27, 1866, and to have let me say good luck, through you. He gave Szold only a
German certificate, for he had not attended the Seminary as a student;
he only lodged with him, but did not study. He has no title Morenu,
and certainly not the permissions to be a rabbi. He has a Morenu and,
perhaps, even a Semicha from the ultraorthodox Rabbi Tiktin in Breslau,
who writes willingly, without knowing the warning of the rabbis. It is
a case of “A disqualified one who makes illegitimate children legitimate”.
So you see again these ultraorthodox. There is no fear of God in this
place, there is no God in another place. Frankel is hurt by your
failure to send him the “Occident”. He will send you his “Monatschrifft”.
He wants to write against Szola. In exchange for that German certificate,
Szola presented the seminary with an entire set of Talmud. “Bribery blinds
even the wise”. Frankel mentions him among the donors, but only as
“Herr Szola, preacher in Baltimore, not “doctor” or “Rabbiner.” What does
Rabbi Abraham Rice say about this ? “The four houses of trampling” which

developed out of the one which he consecrated all of them torn apart
and over-pious, occupying themselves with the treatise about Samaritans
and those who fear sexual looseness.

Couldn't you obtain for me, by means of a Committee sent to Mr.
Hart, a call for one of two lectures on history, over there ? Please
see that it is arranged. “The deed is greater than the doer”. Frankel's
discussion in the program, about marriage, is excellent. I would have
sent it to you, but I am angry. I expect that the entire article will
be printed next week.

Write to me about a lecture. I want to read “Esther” for them,
or about the establishment of the Second Temple. Write to me about it.
Perhaps I could work in the German congregation, but only truth and
peace. I expect a immediate reply.

In the Porutguese congregation here, an examination for Sanochecim? took
place here recently, at which Solomon Joseph and Sanat Phillips were
chosen as Shochetim and Rabbi Abraham as the head of the court. Think,
should such things happen in Israel ? Are these Jews ? They appear to
me like Karaites who have Tzizit and T'phillin hanging in the synagogue.
They may have the schochet and the slaughtering knife also in the syn-
agogue. Stand up the former and hang up the latter. The sensible pro-
posal, to join in with other congregations and appoint schochetim who are
capable, in various parts of the city, was turned down, in order that the
Portuguese Jew who lives in the 40's (streets) should not be forced to
eat slaughtered meat because of the distance. That would be compulsion.
As it is, the schochet stands in his place and we changed the process
around. The slaughtering knife is not placed on the throat, but it hangs
in the air. Einhorn's protest must be welcome to you and to me. He has
made up his mind that that is better. Decision forces decision. Thus
the board will make no further concessions ? The Harts will not permit
Lewengut to represent them. They will attain their ends through
Einhorn. Thank him for it. That is the reason why you should keep si-
lent now. Let the others bargain, who opposed your views, such as Isaacs.
“The wise man has eyes in his head, the fool walks in darkness”. That
is how it had to be. Dr, Raphall called the de Sola “en soof?”.
